SENT.plain: Atrial septal aneurysms have been recognized as sources of arterial embolism
An intraatrial aneurysm was demonstrated in the fossa ovalis of a 45-year-old woman who suffered an episode of cerebral embolism
The disorder is rarely treated surgically
Most patients with this condition are given life-long anticoagulation, a treatment that may have serious complications
As an alternative treatment with possible lower risk, we removed the aneurysm surgically
